abstract.t: This document specifies extensions to IPv6 Neighbor Discovery tocarry site prefixes. The site prefixes are used to reduce the effectof site renumbering by ensuring that the communication inside a siteuses site-local addresses.This protocol requires that all IPv6 implementations, even those thatdo not implement this protocol, ignore all site-local addresses thatthey retrieve from the DNS when the AAAA or A6 RRset contain bothglobal and site-local addresses. If the RRset contains only site-local addresses those addresses can be used.
